        public static TemporaryVar accessIndexArray(MJArrayLookup arrayLookup)
        Input: arrayLookup. an access to an array element (ex: a[5])
        Returns:
        value(@code TemporaryVar) returns the reference to the starting index of an array

      • checkValidArraySize

        public static Operand checkValidArraySize(MJExpr exprSize)
        Parameters:
        exprSize(@code - MJExpr) Returns an Operand Input: an expression containing the size of the array Output: the size of the array being initialized
        Returns:
        the value {@code Operand) returns an error in case the size passed is negative else the totalsize of an array+1

      • checkArrayIndexInRange

        public static void checkArrayIndexInRange(MJArrayLookup arrayLookup)
        Parameters:
        arrayLookup - Checks that index is not negative ( out of lower bound) checks that index is not beyond the array's length (out of upper bound)

      • returnArrayLength

        public static Operand returnArrayLength(MJExpr exprArray)
        Parameters:
        exprArray - contains the expression with the array. ex: e.length --> get e or e[5] --> get e
        Returns:
        Operand --> VarRef(lengthVarReturn) = VarRef(tempVar)

      • initializeArrayValuesToZero

        public static void initializeArrayValuesToZero(TemporaryVar arrayPointer,
                                               Operand operArrSizeInc)
        Parameters:
        arrayPointer: - pointer to the current array
        operArrSizeInc: - size of the array + 1 (where the while loop will loop to) Initializes all values of an array to 0 with a while loop. we can assume never acces index [0] in an array with size 0. loop through all "cells" in the array and assign 0 to them
